English: Night Patrol
Soviet army retreated to Kolguyev
Are you certain, comrade Rashiv?
Yes comrade captain, more than certain. Their intention is to pursue us to Kolguyev.
At least we are now sure that an attack is coming, but the problem is we are far from ready to fight them off.
We are understaffed, underequipped and right now seriously lacking any morale. If they come tomorrow we won't hold for a week.
I thank you for the information, comrade. And the way you managed to evade capture and escape from Everon is truly remarkable.\nI think you deserve a promotion at the very least, comrade corporal!
Thank you, comrade captain!
I'll bring this up with my superiors. You go catch some breath. You deserve it.
Comrade captain, there is one thing I wanted to bring up...
The rebels, they... they made it pretty clear they did not ask for our help and did not see me as a liberator but as an invader.\nThat is the exact opposite of what we were actually told.
I can't say much about this, comrade, but you are a bright fellow and can put the pieces together.\nKnow that I am aware of this.
The order to attack must have come from way above. I wouldn't mention it further if I were you.\nIt would be better if we have never talked about it but.. I can promise I will look into it.
Thank you comrade captain. I am simply concerned...
I know, soldier, but we cannot do much about this right now. We have a much bigger problem on our hands that we must see to.
I like you, comrade Rashiv. Next time we speak, I'll hopefully tell you more.\nFor now, dismissed!
Rise and shine, Sergei! It's time for your night shift.\nFollow me! I'll give you a ride!
What a lovely alarm clock...
It's so dark I can't even see your car.
Hold on, I'll turn the lights on!
Slept well?
Hardly. Kept waking up.
Yeah, I got you. The island is shrouded in a general sense of nervous anticipation and a chilling fear of incoming attack.
Couldn't have said better myself, Vadim. But it is freezing!
You'll get warmer by the fire. It must be below zero at this point, although there is still no snow.\nI guess we won't get snowy Christmas for another year.
If we even get there, Vadim. How's the situation at home, any news?

Still nothing official. There are rumoured reinforcements, but if they were sent they would be here long ago.\nKreml doesn't seem to be able to agree on anything so they pretty much left us to our own devices...
I'm surprised the international community didn't do anything. Or does no one care?
Care for what?\nFew communists getting wrecked by NATO on godforsaken island in the middle of nowhere?\nI'd be surprised if this was even in the news.
Similar thing happened here seven years ago, and that caught their attention.
Yeah because Livanoch had a nuclear arsenal at his disposal. We would be glad for T80s at this point.
Finally, a relief. I was bored out of my mind I tell you! Almost fell asleep an hour ago.
You'll get your sleep soon. Anything out of the ordinary?
Nah, so far so good. Although the patrols were doubled for this shift. There was some radio disturbance earlier in the night.
Where is my partner if they were doubled?
Sorry, it includes only bases and the shoreline. Lack of men.\nIt's going to be only you and the shilka.
It's probably just a false alarm anyway. Like that one a week ago.
Possibly but keep your eyes peeled. It was targeting the southern sector.
Right, let's go then. Hop in the car and I'll take you to your base.
Here, take these night visions and enjoy your shift.
Here we are! Let's relief that guy!
What the hell? American special forces? Shit, they're going after the AA!
BAZA TO SOUTHERN SECTOR PATROLS. HOURLY CHECK. REPORT. OVER.
ANTON TO BAZA. ALL QUIET HERE. OVER.
BORIS TO BAZA. WE'RE CLEAR. OVER.
LEONID TO BAZA, NOTHING TO REPORT. OVER.
KONSTANTIN TO BAZA, THE PATROLS ARE CHANGING RIGHT NOW. ALL CLEAR. OVER.
YELENA TO BAZA. WE'RE SETTING SAIL NOW. EXPECTED CHECK IN FIVE MINUTES. OVER.
ROMAN TO BAZA, EVERYTHING SET HERE. OVER.
BAZA TO SOUTHERN SECTOR PATROLS. KEEP YOUR EYES OPEN. NEXT CHECK IN AN HOUR. BAZA OUT.
YELENA TO BAZA, IT'S THAT RADIO DISTURBANCE AGAIN. SOUTHERN SECTOR. COMING FROM SOMEWHERE OVER THE SEA. OVER.
BAZA TO YELENA, CHANGE YOUR COURSE AND TRY TO PINPOINT THE SOURCE. WE'RE SENDING CHOPPER TO ASSIST YOU FROM THE SKY. BAZA OUT.
ROMAN TO BAZA, ENEMY SPECIAL FORCES TRIED TO GO FOR THE AA, THEY WERE REPELLED BUT THERE MIGHT BE MORE, OVER.

BAZA TO ROMAN, GOOD WORK COMRADE. STAY AT YOUR POSITION, WE'RE SENDING REINFORCEMENTS. BAZA TO ALL UNITS, PUT YOUR MEN ON HIGH ALERT. ENEMY MIGHT TRY TO DISRUPT OUR DEFENCES, ALL UNITS ON HIGH ALERT! BAZA OUT.
ROMAN TO BAZA, I... I MEAN THAT... IT SEEMS THE SHILKA WAS SUPPOSED TO GUARD JUST BLEW UP. SOMEONE MUST HAVE SNUCK IN HERE WHILE I WASN'T LOOKING, OVER.

BAZA TO ROMAN ARE YOU FUCKING KIDDING US? THAT AA WAS VITAL PART OF OUR DEFENCES! FOR CHRIST SAKE MAN, ARE YOU THAT INCOMPETENT OR JUST DUMB AS FUCK? BAZA TO ALL UNITS, PUT YOUR MEN ON HIGH ALERT, THE ENEMY IS HERE SABOTAGING, I REPEAT, ALL UNITS ON HIGH ALERT! BAZA OUT.
Guard the AA System
You've acquired Night Vision Goggles
